title: Pre-course work: Git for Scientists
text:
Thank you for your interest in this course. Your course instructor Lars Schöbitz is looking forward to meet you.
We will meet on Tuesday, 27 May 2025 - 10:00 am to 12:00 noon CET at the PhD retreat of Computational and Information Sciences (CIS) group at ETH Zurich.
Please ensure you have the following available:
Prior to the workshop, there is some pre-work for you to do. This pre-work will ensure that we can focus our time together on learning instead of setting up infrastructure.

title: Pre-course work: Git for Scientists
section: What do I need to prepare before the workshop?
text:
What do I need to prepare before the workshop?
Prior to the workshop, complete the following seven steps:

Step 1: Register your ORCID iD.
Step 2: Log into Posit Cloud and join the course workspace.
Step 3: Create an account for Quarto Pub.
Step 4: Fill out the pre-course survey by Thursday, 22 May 2025.
Step 5:
Step 6:
Step 7: Check your complete setup by Monday, 26 May 2025.

title: Pre-course work: Git for Scientists

Thanks!
Thank you for working through these steps. We are looking forward to meeting you at the course.

title: R and RStudio
text:
Do you already have a R version of R and RStudio?





Even if you already have R and RStudio installed, it is strongly recommended to download and install the latest versions to ensure compatibility with Quarto and access to the newest features and updates. Up-to-date installations help avoid unexpected errors and ensure all features work as intended.

title: R and RStudio
section: Download and install R and RStudio
text:
Download and install R and RStudio

R for Windows: https://cran.rstudio.com/bin/windows/
R for Mac: https://cran.rstudio.com/bin/macosx/ (Note: Two separate downloads for Apple silicon M1, M2, etc. Macs and Intel Macs)
RStudio: https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/ for your operating system (Windows or Mac)
Follow your operating system’s installation process
